author: ashvardanian
content:
We have been building a new JSON-RPC implementation recently. Its designed for newer Linux kernels (5.19+) and seems to be the fastest public implementation for the TCP/IP stack. Would it be of value to the Ethereum project or it's satellites? ðŸ¤— 

https://github.com/unum-cloud/ujrpc

author: ryanleeschneider
content: thats some very impressive numbers, but the vast majority of cpu time on clients isn't spent in the JSONRPC layer itself but rather all the logic that needs to happen to service the actual request (e.g. reading state, initializing an EVM instance, etc.)
